meanings.definition: The act of cutting and drying grass to make hay.
meanings.sent1: During the hayings, the farmers worked hard under the sun.
meanings.sent2: The hayings in summer ensure there is enough feed for the animals in winter.
meanings.sent3: The hayings turned into a fun competition among the villagers.
meanings.sent4: The hayings were like a dance of nature, transforming green fields into golden bales.
meanings.sent5: The smell of hayings lingered in the air, a reminder of the season's hard work.

meanings.definition: The period of time during which hay is cut and dried.
meanings.sent1: Last year, the hayings lasted longer due to the rainy weather.
meanings.sent2: The hayings usually take place in late spring or early summer.
meanings.sent3: The hayings seemed to stretch on forever, making the farmers weary.
meanings.sent4: In the midst of hayings, time felt suspended, like the grass waiting to be baled.
meanings.sent5: The hayings marked the transition from growth to preservation in the farming cycle.

meanings.sent1: The barn was filled to the brim with the hayings from the fields.
meanings.sent2: The hayings were neatly stacked in rows, ready to feed the livestock.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids played hide-and-seek among the hayings in the storage shed.
meanings.sent4: The hayings resembled golden waves frozen in time, waiting to be used.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the hayings brought a sense of accomplishment to the hardworking farmers.
